Project Name: Minasian (Caro) Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts
Title: Tuḥfah-ʾi ʿAbbāsī
Description.tableOfContents: Title: Ḥilyat al-muttaqīn; Text includes 15 chapters on Shiite popular beliefs based on jurisprudence. Ch.1 On the manner of dress Ch.2 On the wearing of ornaments and jewles Ch.3 On the etiquette of eating and drinking Ch.4 On marriage and sexual intercourse with women and the education of children Ch.5 On personal hygiene (brushing one's hair and teeth) Ch.6 On perfuming oneself Ch.7 On showering Ch.8 On sleeping Ch.12 On entering and leaving the house Ch.14 On riding, walking Ch.15 On travels. Arabic chapter headings are in the naskh script. Composed ca. A.H. 1079.
Subject: Shīʿah $x Doctrines $v Early works to 1800
Name.repository: University of California, Los Angeles. $b Library Special Collections
Author: Qummī, Muḥammad Ṭāhir, $d d. 1686 or 7
Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 25, 160
Description.abstract: Beginning and end are missing. Manuscript contains rubrics.
Description.citation: Āghā Buzurg al-Ṭihrānī, Dharīʿah ilā taṣānif al-Shīʿah (Al-Najaf: Maṭbaʿat al-Gharrā, 1936-1986), v. 3 (1645), p. 452.|~|Munzavī v. 2 pt. 1 p.910.|~|Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1039 AH), p. 15.

Project Name: Minasian (Caro) Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts
Title: Kitab-i Kubrá
Description.tableOfContents: Title: Kubrá; A philosophical treatise on topics regarding logic, such as definitions, propositions, and syllogisms. Includes marginal notes.|~|Title: Sharḥ Īsāghūjī; A commentary by Ḥusām al-Dīn al-Kātī on Athīr al-Dīn al-Abharī's commentary on the Greek philosopher Porphyry's work on logic, Isagoge (known in Arabic as Īsāghūjī), a treatise in logic, such as definitions, propositions, and syllogisms. Includes marginal notes.|~|Title: Hāshiyat Sharḥ al-Īsāghūjī; Includes notes in the margins. A commentary on al-Abharī's Iṣāghujī. A philosophical treatise on main topics in logic such as definitions, propositions, and syllogisms.|~|Title: Sharḥ al-Isāghūjī
Subject: Logic
Name.repository: University of California, Los Angeles. $b Library Special Collections
Author: Jurjānī, ʿAlī ibn Muḥammad, $c al-Sayyid al-Sharīf, $d 1340-1413
Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 29, 184
Description.abstract: In this treatise the science of logic discusses human faculties and perceptions and their relations with the rational, perceptible and imperceptible.
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1039 AH), p. 668.
Description.stamp: Dr. Caro Minasian's personal stamp only.
